revised_title: Co-relations and their Measurement: An Exploration of Anthropometric Data
tldr: The author, Francis Galton, introduces the concept of correlation and its measurement, particularly in the context of anthropometric data. He explains the relationship between the length of the arm and the leg, and how deviations in one are accompanied by deviations in the other. Galton also discusses the use of probable error as a unit of measurement and provides examples of how this concept can be applied to various physical attributes.
